intro: Lotononis pungens, commonly known as the African violets, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, waxy leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub with upright stems and produces small, tubular flowers in shades of white, pink, and purple. It thrives in bright, indirect light and well-draining soil, making it a popular houseplant. Its ornamental value and ease of care contribute to its widespread cultivation.
